overview: The purpose of this measure is to make the Women's Court Pilot Program in the First Circuit permanent and to establish and appropriate funds for a Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [13] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years. [13]
appropriations: The measure appropriates $514,900 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027. [13] These funds are for mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services and equipment. [13] The appropriation also provides for the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [13]
assumptions_and_methodology: This measure has been amended by changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years. [14] A sunset date for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit has been set for June 30, 2027. [13]
agency_impact: The Judiciary is now responsible for providing mental health services under the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [13] The appropriation includes funding for the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the pilot program. [13]
policy_impact: This measure has been amended by codifying the Women's Court Program in the First Circuit within the Hawaii Revised Statutes, rather than the Session Laws of Hawaii. [13] Language that would have required the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in other circuits has been deleted. [13] The effective date has been changed to July 1, 2025, and the sunset date for the Kona pilot program is changed to June 30, 2027. [13]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The measure appropriates $514,900 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [13] The duration of this pilot program has been changed from three years to two years. [13] Funding is for mental health, substance abuse treatment, other services and equipment, and the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position. [13] The sunset date for the Kona pilot program is June 30, 2027. [13] The Women's Court Program in the First Circuit is now a permanent program. [13]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The Women's Court Program in the First Circuit is made permanent, which will have ongoing fiscal implications. [13] The Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit is set to be discontinued with a sunset date of June 30, 2027. [13]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit was changed from three years to two years.
